pattern.name: Baby Hat, Shoes & Mittens Luxury Set
pattern.gauge_description: 22 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
pattern.notes_html:
These adorable accessories are the perfect set for any new born. Looking for that extra special gift? This ribbon trimmed set comprising of Hat, Shoes and Mitts is just the ticket.

Knit in luxurious easy care Cashmerino Silk blend, these accessories are reassuringly delicate, soft and smooth.

The Hat is knit in the round and the mitts and shoes are worked flat on two needles.

Sized to fit approx. ages birth to 6 months.

Finished Measurement:

Mittens: 5cm long

Hat: 35cm circumference

Shoes: 8 cm long

Yarn:

Sublime Baby Cashmere Merino Silk DK, shade 346, Dusty Pink, two 50g balls

75% Extra Fine Merino, 20% Silk, 5% Cashmere 116m/50g

Needles:

3.25mm straight needles

3.25mm & 4mm DPN’s or needles for working in the round

Also needed:

2m ribbon (1 cm wide)

Sewing needle and thread

Tapestry needle

Stitch markers

packs.yarn_name: Sublime Yarns Baby Cashmere Merino Silk DK

pattern_author.name: Jane Burns
pattern_author.notes:
Hello. I’m Jane.

I am a knit and crochet based in Lincoln, UK. Designing projects that as are as much fun to make, as they are to wear is my focus.

Looking for whimsical knitting patterns for babies and children, please check out my catalogue.

With over 15 years experience of writing knitting patterns for the UK knitting magazines, I pride myself on well written easy to follow instructions.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Simply Knitting, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. I’ve also produced mini collections for Scheepjes, King Cole and Eden Cottage Yarns. 

I think I have one of the best jobs in the world. It has enabled me to meet lots of very talented crafters. Work with some fantastic yarn companies and even appear on live TV. That was one of the most exhilarating experiences of my life. Who knows, maybe one day I will get to do it again.

When I’m not designing you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or enjoying live music (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) 

I share my life with my husband, Doug,  my three, now not so little children and my mini schnauzer Bertie.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to [download your free gift  here][1].

***You can buy my patterns from my [Ravelry store, here][2]***

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.



  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns

users.about_me:
Hello. I’m Jane.

I create beautiful designs for knitters and crocheters who love to work with gorgeous yarns. I help them to make fun and playful projects that are an indulgence to work on and a treat to wear.

My designs are perfect for those who love to create intricate looking projects without lots of complicated instructions. I believe that crafting should be a relaxing pleasure. It’s my mission to bring clear and easy to execute designs, which are accessible for newer knitters and provide instant gratification for the more experienced.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. Had the privilege of designing for Eden Cottage Yarns, King Cole and a Scheepjes.   My slightly quirkier work has been featured on television alongside Harry Hill.

When I’m not designing my latest socks or playing with beautiful hand dyed yarns from the dyers I love, you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or at a live gig (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) As a result, you’ll find my work is influenced a lot by music, my other main passion.

I share my life with my husband, Doug, who proposed at a Foo Fighters gig, and my three children and Bertie my mini schnauzer.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to download your free sock pattern [here][1].


***You can buy my patterns from my Ravelry store***, [here][2]

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.

If you would like to become part of the [Jane Burns Designs community,][3] please join the group and say hello....


  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/jane-burns-designs

Hello. I’m Jane.

I create beautiful designs for knitters and crocheters who love to work with gorgeous yarns. I help them to make fun and playful projects that are an indulgence to work on and a treat to wear.

My designs are perfect for those who love to create intricate looking projects without lots of complicated instructions. I believe that crafting should be a relaxing pleasure. It’s my mission to bring clear and easy to execute designs, which are accessible for newer knitters and provide instant gratification for the more experienced.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. Had the privilege of designing for Eden Cottage Yarns, King Cole and a Scheepjes. My slightly quirkier work has been featured on television alongside Harry Hill.

When I’m not designing my latest socks or playing with beautiful hand dyed yarns from the dyers I love, you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or at a live gig (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) As a result, you’ll find my work is influenced a lot by music, my other main passion.

I share my life with my husband, Doug, who proposed at a Foo Fighters gig, and my three children and Bertie my mini schnauzer.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to download your free sock pattern here.

You can buy my patterns from my Ravelry store, here

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.

If you would like to become part of the Jane Burns Designs community, please join the group and say hello….
